properties.areaDesc: Grays Harbor, WA; Jefferson, WA; Clallam, WA
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued January 21 at 2:26PM PST until January 24 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Seattle has expanded the

* Flood Watch to include a portion of northwest Washington,
including the following counties, Clallam, Grays Harbor, and
Jefferson.

* From Wednesday evening through late Thursday night

* A period of warming, rising snow levels, and heavy rain in the
mountains will force sharp rises on the rivers flowing off the
Olympics. Snow levels will rise to around 6,000 to 7,000 feet
with 3 to 9 inches of rain in the mountains late Wednesday
through Saturday. River flooding is possible as a result.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

You should monitor latest forecasts and be alert for possible
Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be
prepared to take action should flooding develop.

Latest river forecasts available at
water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=sew

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT
